tool.name: MultiExtractRasterTool

param.name: polygons
param.dialogReference: The feature class with clipping shapes. Each polygon will create a new raster.

param.name: out_ws
param.dialogReference: A geodatabase or folder to save the new rasters into. The destination must already exist. If the destination is a folder, the rasters will be saved in TIFF format.

param.name: name_field
param.dialogReference: A TEXT field in the polygon feature class that will provide a name to each of the new rasters.

param.name: name_expr
param.displayname: Python expression with 'name' to customize output raster name
param.dialogReference:
A python expression to manipulate the contents of the name field. The variable called name will be available and is a string.

For example:

name.lower().replace(" ", "_") + "_clip"

Can be used to make all letters in name lowercase and to replace spaces with underscores. Then the string "_clip" is appended to the end.

param.name: sql_filter
param.dialogReference: A SQL WHERE clause used to select a subset of features from the clipping polygons. This is similar to using the SQL input in "Select features by attribute."

tool.summary: A tool to use multiple polygons to clip or extract many smaller rasters from a single large one. The extracted rasters can be saved to a geodatabase or folder.
